location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 44 of 1866 from Lieutenant-Colonel Lewis Pelly, Political Agent, Persian Gulf, Bushire to Charles Gonne, Secretary to Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: Letter regarding the beneficial results being shown for trade and commerce in the Gulf from Pelly's lesson to the 'slaving and piratical tribes' at Soor [Sur] and the impact that these benefits have had on the negotiations with the Wahabees [Wahhabis].
